availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Martin Pendergrast (Louisville, Kentucky, convicted of manslaughter)

body.p:
Cook County, Illinois, laborer and soldier. Native of Ireland. Married to Ann Pendergast. Laborer in Cook County, Illinois, in 1860. Served in the 67th Illinois Infantry as a private.
Subject of a December 1864 petition to Thomas E. Bramlette requesting Pendergrastâ€™s pardon on conviction of manslaughter.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Illinois, Cook County, Chicago Ward 9, p. 198.
Indexes to the Carded Records of Soldiers Who Served in Volunteer Organizations During the Civil War, NARA M539, RG 94, Roll 070.
KYR-0001-004-1390.
